page.title: 01Southend:The Area
page.content: {Southend-on-Sea},a seaside resort on the Thames Estuary was popularised in Victorian days.Now it is a busy , generally residential area with a large shopping centre, a seafront with arcades and hotels and the famous pier. Parks and sports clubs in the area cope for the sporting needs of the residents and the beach attracts people in the heat of the summer.Two railway lines to London and an extensive bus service provide the people of Southend with ample public transport for journeying to and from work, school, and to commute. As the Priory of Prittlewell grew the south end adopted the name "Southend".Since the end of the last century the whole town has been known as{"Southend-on-Sea".}
